label: Exclusively breastfed at 1st day of surveillance
definition: Whether the participant was exclusively breastfeeding on the 1st day of bi-weekly breastfeeding surveillance data collection. Baseline breastfeeding information was collected upon enrollment.
codebookDescription: Indicates whether exclusive breastfeeding was present on day of first SAF data collection, the age at which this occurred is the minage. Source=calculated.

label: Breastfed within 1st 24hrs
definition: Whether the participant began breastfeeding within 24 hours after birth. Baseline breastfeeding information was collected upon enrollment.
codebookDescription: Whether the child began breastfeeding within 24 hours per the CAF. Source=calculated.

label: Time between childbirth and 1st breastfeeding
definition: How long after childbirth did the mother begin breastfeeding the participant. Baseline breastfeeding information was collected upon enrollment.
codebookDescription: How long after childbirth did the mother begin breastfeeding him/her. Source=CAF. 0=within 1 hr; 1=1-24hrs; 2=1-3days; 3=4+ days later

label: Fed colostrum
definition: Whether the participant was fed the first milk (colostrum). Baseline breastfeeding information was collected upon enrollment.
codebookDescription: Was the child fed the first milk (colostrum)?. Source=CAF.

label: Prelacteal feeding
definition: Whether there was prelacteal feeding of the participant. Baseline breastfeeding information was collected upon enrollment.
codebookDescription: Was there prelacteal feeding of the child?. Source=CAF.

label: Cumulative days exclusively breastfed
definition: Cumulative sum of days with exclusive breastfeeding (ie, number of days, from birth to date, that the participant was reported to be exclusively breastfed). Between birth and the 1st bi-weekly breastfeeding survey, participants who began breastfeeding at all were considered to be exclusively breastfed. Breastfeeding surveillance occurred twice per week throughout 24 or 36 months of age.
codebookDescription: Cumulative days of exclusive breastfeeding from birth. This is a cumulative sum of the variable ''excrun'', i.e., number of days, to date from birth, that the child was reported to be exclusively breastfed. This has been filled in between birth and minage with EBF if child began breastfeeding at all (cafbegbf~=.). Exclusive breastfeeding prevalence can be calculated by dividing cumexc / age (or days of follow up). This is a cumulative sum so that we can merge this dataset with others and determine what percent of the time a child was exclusively, predominantly, partially, and not breastfed prior to some outcome (anthro, illness, etc.).. Source=calculated.

label: Cumulative days not breastfed
definition: Cumulative sum of days with no breastfeeding (ie, number of days, from birth to date, that the participant was reported to not be breastfed). Breastfeeding surveillance occurred twice per week throughout 24 or 36 months of age.
codebookDescription: Cumulative days of no breastfeeding (cumulative sum of nobfrun, ie, number of days from birth, to date, that the child was reported to not be breastfed).. This is a cumulative sum so that we can merge this dataset with others and determine what percent of the time a child was exclusively, predominantly, partially, and not breastfed prior to some outcome (anthro, illness, etc.).. Source=calculated.

label: Cumulative days partially breastfed
definition: Cumulative sum of days with partial breastfeeding (ie, number of days, from birth to date, that the participant was reported to be partially breastfed). Breastfeeding surveillance occurred twice per week throughout 24 or 36 months of age.
codebookDescription: Cumulative days of partial breastfeeding (cumulative sum of partrun, ie, number of days, to date, that the child was reported to be partially breastfed).. New predominant and partial variables considering animal milk to be ingested with tea in Pakistan (even if animal milk is not indicated on the SAF). Source=calculated.

label: Cumulative days predominantly breastfed
definition: Cumulative sum of days with predominant breastfeeding (ie, number of days, from birth to date, that the participant was reported to be predominantly breastfed). Breastfeeding surveillance occurred twice per week throughout 24 or 36 months of age.
codebookDescription: Cumulative days of predominant breastfeeding (cumulative sum of predrun, ie, number of days, to date, that the child was reported to be predominantly breastfed).. New predominant and partial variables considering animal milk to be ingested with tea in Pakistan (even if animal milk is not indicated on the SAF). Source=calculated.

label: Dairy reported at last visit
definition: Whether presence of dairy (milk, formula, yogurt, cheese, or other dairy products) in the diet was reported at the last breastfeeding surveillance visit. Breastfeeding surveillance occurred twice per week throughout 24 or 36 months of age.
codebookDescription: Dairy intake (milk, formula, yogurt, cheese, or other dairy products, as reported on the SAF or MOA). This is a simple variable that reflects the presence of dairy in the diet at last reported diet day.. Source=calculated.

label: Exclusively breastfed at last visit
definition: Whether exclusive breastfeeding (breastfeeding present with no other liquids or solids) was reported at the last visit. Participants could switch back and forth between exclusive and different types of non-exclusive breastfeeding. Data between breastfeeding surveillance visits were filled in forward. Breastfeeding surveillance occurred twice per week throughout 24 or 36 months of age.
codebookDescription: Exclusive breastfeeding (breastfeeding present, no liquid, no solids). This is a simple variable that reflects the exclusive breastfeeding status at last reported diet day. Children can switch back and forth between exclusive and different types of non-exclusive breastfeeding.. These variables provide the breastfeeding category at the last visit (since data between visits are filled in forward).. Source=calculated.

label: Breastfeeding survival analysis event
definition: Whether the participant received non-breast milk foods or were lost to follow-up, to be used in survival analysis. Breastfeeding surveillance occurred twice per week throughout 24 or 36 months of age.
codebookDescription: To be used in survival analysis, variable indicates where the EBF child received non-breast milk foods (1) or if they were lost to follow up (0). Source=calculated.

label: Age last exclusively breastfed (days)
definition: Maximum age in days of imputed exclusive breastfeeding (liquid or food given on next day), only including participants who were reported to be given non-breast milk foods. This variable changed starting with the first occasion clear liquid, animal milk, formula, or solid food were given, and did not allow for back and forth. Breastfeeding surveillance occurred twice per week throughout 24 or 36 months of age.
codebookDescription: Maximum age of imputed exclusive breastfeeding (liquid or food given on next day).. These calculations change feeding definitions starting with the first occasion.  They do not allow for back and forth. Source=calculated.

label: Age at 1st day of biweekly breastfeeding surveillance (days)
definition: Minimum age in days at which bi-weekly breastfeeding surveillance data is available. Baseline breastfeeding information was collected upon enrollment.
codebookDescription: Minimum age in days at which SAF diet data is available. Source=calculated.

label: Age 1st animal milk or formula given (days)
definition: Age in days at which first animal milk (including animal milk ingested with tea in Pakistan) or formula was given. This variable changed feeding definitions for 'Breastfeeding status' and 'Age last exclusively breastfed (days)' starting with the first occasion animal milk or formula were given, and did not allow for back and forth. Breastfeeding surveillance occurred twice per week throughout 24 or 36 months of age.
codebookDescription: Age at which first milk is given. New predominant and partial variables considering animal milk to be ingested with tea in Pakistan (even if animal milk is not indicated on the SAF). Source=calculated.

label: Age at complete weaning (days)
definition: Age in days at which breastfeeding ceases (complete weaning), if observed at all. This variable changed feeding definitions for 'Breastfeeding status' and 'Age last exclusively breastfed (days)' starting with the first occasion complete weaning was observed, and did not allow for back and forth. Breastfeeding surveillance occurred twice per week throughout 24 or 36 months of age.
codebookDescription: Age at which breastfeeding ceases (complete weaning: if observed in data set at all). These calculations change feeding definitions starting with the first occasion.  They do not allow for back and forth.. Source=calculated.

label: Age 1st animal milk or solids given (days)
definition: Age in days at which first animal milk (including animal milk ingested with tea in Pakistan) OR solids was given. This variable changed feeding definitions for 'Breastfeeding status' and 'Age last exclusively breastfed (days)' starting with the first occasion animal milk or solids were given, and did not allow for back and forth. Breastfeeding surveillance occurred twice per week throughout 24 or 36 months of age.
codebookDescription: Age at which first milk OR solids is given. New predominant and partial variables considering animal milk to be ingested with tea in Pakistan (even if animal milk is not indicated on the SAF). Source=calculated.

label: Age 1st clear liquid given (days)
definition: Age in days at which first clear liquid is given. This variable changed feeding definitions for 'Breastfeeding status' and 'Age last exclusively breastfed (days)' starting with the first occasion clear liquid was given, and did not allow for back and forth. Breastfeeding surveillance occurred twice per week throughout 24 or 36 months of age.
codebookDescription: Age at which first clear liquid is given. New predominant and partial variables considering animal milk to be ingested with tea in Pakistan (even if animal milk is not indicated on the SAF). Source=calculated.

label: Age 1st solid food given (days)
definition: Age in days at which first solid food is given. This variable changed feeding definitions for 'Breastfeeding status' and 'Age last exclusively breastfed (days)' starting with the first occasion solid food was given, and did not allow for back and forth. Breastfeeding surveillance occurred twice per week throughout 24 or 36 months of age.
codebookDescription: Age at which first solid food is given. These calculations change feeding definitions starting with the first occasion.  They do not allow for back and forth.. Source=calculated.

label: Not breastfed at last visit
definition: Whether no breastfeeding was reported at the last visit. Participants could switch back and forth between exclusive and different types of non-exclusive breastfeeding. Data between breastfeeding surveillance visits were filled in forward. Breastfeeding surveillance occurred twice per week throughout 24 or 36 months of age.
codebookDescription: No breastfeeding reported at last reported diet day.. These variables provide the breastfeeding category at the last visit (since data between visits are filled in forward).. Source=calculated.

label: Partially breastfed at last visit
definition: Whether partial breastfeeding (breastfeeding present with solids, animal milk (considering animal milk to be ingested with tea in Pakistan), and/or formula) was reported at the last visit. Participants could switch back and forth between exclusive and different types of non-exclusive breastfeeding. Data between breastfeeding surveillance visits were filled in forward. Breastfeeding surveillance occurred twice per week throughout 24 or 36 months of age.
codebookDescription: Partial breastfeeding (breastfeeding present with solids, milks, and/or formula) This is a simple variable that reflects the breastfeeding status at last reported diet day.. New predominant and partial variables considering animal milk to be ingested with tea in Pakistan (even if animal milk is not indicated on the SAF). Source=calculated.

label: Predominantly breastfed at last visit
definition: Whether predominant breastfeeding (breastfeeding and clear liquids (water, fruit juice, tea, other liquids) present, with no solids, animal milk (considering animal milk to be ingested with tea in Pakistan), or formula) was reported at the last visit. Participants could switch back and forth between exclusive and different types of non-exclusive breastfeeding. Data between breastfeeding surveillance visits were filled in forward. Breastfeeding surveillance occurred twice per week throughout 24 or 36 months of age.
codebookDescription: Predominant breastfeeding (breastfeeding present, clear liquids (water, fruit juice, tea, other liquids), no solids, no milk or formula). This is a simple variable that reflects the breastfeeding status at last reported diet day.. New predominant and partial variables considering animal milk to be ingested with tea in Pakistan (even if animal milk is not indicated on the SAF). Source=calculated.

label: Breastfeeding status
definition: Breastfeeding status was changed starting with the first occasion clear liquid, animal milk, formula, or solid food were given, and did not allow for back and forth. Breastfeeding surveillance occurred twice per week throughout 24 or 36 months of age.
codebookDescription: These calculations change feeding definitions starting with the first occasion.  They do not allow for back and forth.. Source=calculated. 0 during exclusive breastfeeding, 1 when any non-breast milk feeding starts until last breastmilk reported, 2 after last breast milk is ingested.t

label: Breastfeeding data present today
definition: Whether breastfeeding data was present today or not. Data were generally collected for yesterday's diet (ie, the day prior to the day the field worker is in the home). Breastfeeding surveillance occurred twice per week throughout 24 or 36 months of age.
codebookDescription: Whether the data was present today (1) or not (0). For bf, data were generally collected for yesterday's diet, ie, the day prior to the day the field worker is in the home.. Source=calculated. 1=yes, 0=no.

codebookDescription: Total number of meals consumed by the child on this day of food recall. Source=Calculated.

codebookDescription: Assessment is conducted in target window, extened window, out of window. Source=FRQ. out of window = 0, in target window = 1, in extended window = 2

label: Went 24hrs without food last month
definition: In the past four weeks, whether any member of the participant's household had go a whole day and night without eating anything because there was not enough food. Food security was assessed every 6 months from 0-24 months, with optional assessments at 30 and 36 months.
codebookDescription: In the past four weeks, did you or any household member go a whole day and night without eating anything because there was not enough food?. Source=FSQ. no (00); rarely (01); sometimes (02); often (03); don't know/no response (na)

label: Ate foods not wanted last month
definition: In the past four weeks, whether any member of the participant's household had to eat some foods that they really did not want to eat because of a lack of resources to obtain other types of food. Food security was assessed every 6 months from 0-24 months, with optional assessments at 30 and 36 months.
codebookDescription: In the past four weeks, did you or any household member have to eat some foods that you really did not want to eat because of a lack of resources to obtain other types of food?. Source=FSQ. no (00); rarely (01); sometimes (02); often (03); don't know/no response (na)

label: Not able to eat preferred foods last month
definition: In the past four weeks, whether any member of the participant's household was not able to eat the kinds of foods they preferred because of a lack of resources. Food security was assessed every 6 months from 0-24 months, with optional assessments at 30 and 36 months.
codebookDescription: In the past four weeks, were you or any household member not able to eat the kinds of foods you preferred because of a lack of resources?. Source=FSQ. no (00); rarely (01); sometimes (02); often (03); don't know/no response (na)

label: Ate fewer meals due to lack of food last month
definition: In the past four weeks, whether any member of the participant's household had to eat fewer meals in a day because there was not enough food. Food security was assessed every 6 months from 0-24 months, with optional assessments at 30 and 36 months.
codebookDescription: In the past four weeks, did you or any other household member have to eat fewer meals in a day because there was not enough food?. Source=FSQ. no (00); rarely (01); sometimes (02); often (03); don't know/no response (na)

label: Went to sleep hungry last month
definition: In the past four weeks, whether any member of the participant's household had go to sleep at night hungry because there was not enough food. Food security was assessed every 6 months from 0-24 months, with optional assessments at 30 and 36 months.
codebookDescription: In the past four weeks, did you or any household member go to sleep at night hungry because there was not enough food?. Source=FSQ. no (00); rarely (01); sometimes (02); often (03); don't know/no response (na)

label: Had to eat a limited variety of foods last month
definition: In the past four weeks, whether any member of the participant's household had to eat a limited variety of foods due to a lack of resources. Food security was assessed every 6 months from 0-24 months, with optional assessments at 30 and 36 months.
codebookDescription: In the past four weeks, did you or any household member have to eat a limited variety of foods due to a lack of resources?. Source=FSQ. no (00); rarely (01); sometimes (02); often (03); don't know/no response (na)

label: No food of any kind last month
definition: In the past four weeks, whether there was ever no food to eat of any kind in the participant's household because of lack of resources to get food. Food security was assessed every 6 months from 0-24 months, with optional assessments at 30 and 36 months.
codebookDescription: In the past four weeks, was there ever no food to eat of any kind in your household because of lack of resources to get food?. Source=FSQ. no (00); rarely (01); sometimes (02); often (03); don't know/no response (na)

label: Worried that there was not enough food last month
definition: In the past four weeks, whether the participant's mother, primary caregiver, or head of household worried that the household would not have enough food. Food security was assessed every 6 months from 0-24 months, with optional assessments at 30 and 36 months.
codebookDescription: In the past four weeks, did you worry that your household would not have enough food?. Source=FSQ. no (00); rarely (01); sometimes (02); often (03); don't know/no response (na)

label: Ate smaller meal than needed last month
definition: In the past four weeks, whether any member of the participant's household had to eat a smaller meal than they felt they needed because there was not enough food. Food security was assessed every 6 months from 0-24 months, with optional assessments at 30 and 36 months.
codebookDescription: In the past four weeks, did you or any household member have to eat a smaller meal than you felt you needed because there was not enough food?. Source=FSQ. no (00); rarely (01); sometimes (02); often (03); don't know/no response (na)

label: Household Food Insecurity Access Scale (HFIAS)
definition: Category based on methods described in Coates et al. Household Food Insecurity Access Scale (HFIAS) for Measurement of Household Food Access: Indicator Guide (version 3). Food security was assessed every 6 months from 0-24 months, with optional assessments at 30 and 36 months.
codebookDescription: Household Food Insecurity Access Scale Category (based on Coates J, Swindale A, Bilinsky P 2007 FANTA) . Source=calculated. 1=none, 2=mild, 3=moderate, 4=severe

label: Target month for food security survey
definition: Food security was assessed every 6 months from 0-24 months, with optional assessments at 30 and 36 months.
codebookDescription: Target/scheduled month. Source=FRQ/FSQ/BRF/UCF/SRF/FSE/MOA.

label: Household Food Insecurity Access Scale (HFIAS) score
definition: Sum of 9 variables assessing household food access in the past four weeks. Values ranged from 0 (least food access insecure) to 27 (most food access insecure). Food security was assessed every 6 months from 0-24 months, with optional assessments at 30 and 36 months.
codebookDescription: sum of FSQFSHORT, FSQFDIV,FSQFLIM, FSQFDISLIKE, FSEFSMALL, FSEFFEW, FSQNOFOOD, FSQFHUNG, FSQFDAY. Source=calculated. 0-27

label: Food security survey conducted in target window
definition: Whether food security was assessed within a -/+ 15 day target window. Food security was assessed every 6 months from 0-24 months, with optional assessments at 30 and 36 months.
codebookDescription: Assessment is conducted in target window, extened window, out of window. Source=FRQ. out of window = 0, in target window = 1, in extended window = 2

label: Cumulative days in this ALRI episode
definition: Cumulative count of days that fall within the current ALRI episode. ALRI episodes were separated by 14 ALRI-free days. Days when data are missing were classified as ALRI-free (if there were 14 missing days before a day with ALRI, the episode started on day with ALRI). Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Day of ALRI episode. calculated, ALRI

label: ALRI episode status
definition: Whether this day of observation marked the beginning of a acute lower respiratory infection episode or was within an ALRI episode. ALRI episodes were separated by 14 ALRI-free days. Days when data are missing were classified as ALRI-free (if there were 14 missing days before a day with ALRI, the episode started on day with ALRI). Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: 2 at beginning of episode, 1 within episode. ALRI episodes are separated by 14 ALRI-free days. In this dataset, days when data are missing are thought to be ALRI-free (so if there are 14 missing days before a day with ALRI, the episode starts on the ALRI

label: 1st day of ALRI episode
definition: Whether this was the first day of an ALRI episode. ALRI episodes were separated by 14 ALRI-free days. Days when data are missing were classified as ALRI-free (if there were 14 missing days before a day with ALRI, the episode started on day with ALRI). Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: 1 if first day of episode, 0 if not. calculated, ALRI

label: Study-defined ALRI
definition: Whether the participant had an acute lower respiratory Infection. Participants who had a cough or shortness of breath (today or yesterday) PLUS a rapid respiratory rate (defined as: >60 breaths/min in participants aged 0 to <2 months, >50 breaths/min in participants aged 2 to <12 months and >40 breaths/min in participants aged 12 months to three years) were determined to have ALRI. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: 1 if ALRI, 0 if no ALRI. ALRI definition met when 1) Child had cough or shortness of breath (today or yesterday) & 2) Rapid respiration rate today (average of two measurements) as defined by a) >60 when child is <60 days old, b) >50 when child is >60-<365

label: ALRI episode #
definition: All days of observation that fall within an ALRI episode are coded with the ALRI episode count. ALRI episodes were separated by 14 ALRI-free days. Days when data are missing were classified as ALRI-free (if there were 14 missing days before a day with ALRI, the episode started on day with ALRI). Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: All days in episode coded with number of episode. calculated, ALRI

label: Day in ALRI episode
definition: Whether this day of observation falls within an ALRI episode. ALRI episodes were separated by 14 ALRI-free days. Days when data are missing were classified as ALRI-free (if there were 14 missing days before a day with ALRI, the episode started on day with ALRI). Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: 1 for all days in episode (all days with "ALRI"). calculated, ALRI

label: Cumulative ALRI episode count
definition: Cumulative count of ALRI episodes since beginning of follow-up. ALRI episodes were separated by 14 ALRI-free days. Days when data are missing were classified as ALRI-free (if there were 14 missing days before a day with ALRI, the episode started on day with ALRI). Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Cumulative number of ALRI episodes. calculated, ALRI

label: Cumulative days within ALRI episodes
definition: Cumulative count of days that fall within any ALRI episode since beginning of follow-up. ALRI episodes were separated by 14 ALRI-free days. Days when data are missing were classified as ALRI-free (if there were two missing days before a day with ALRI, the episode started on day with ALRI). Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Cumulative number of days in ALRI episode (episodes separated by 14 ALRI-'free' days). calculated, ALRI

label: Cumulative days within diarrheal episodes
definition: Cumulative count of days that fall within any diarrheal episode since beginning of follow-up. Diarrhea episodes were separated by two diarrhea-free days. Days when data are missing were classified as diarrhea-free (if there were two missing days before a day with diarrhea, the episode started on day with diarrhea). Days with Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M)-induced diarrhea were classified as diarrhea-free. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Cumulative sum of diarrhea days (dprev3) since beginning of follow up, calculated. General diarrhea data (removes LM induced diarrhea).

label: Cumulative diarrheal episode count
definition: Cumulative count of diarrheal episodes since beginning of follow-up. Diarrhea episodes were separated by two diarrhea-free days. Days when data are missing were classified as diarrhea-free (if there were two missing days before a day with diarrhea, the episode started on day with diarrhea). Days with Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M)-induced diarrhea were classified as diarrhea-free. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Cumulative sum of diarrhea episodes (dint3) since beginning of follow up, calculated. General diarrhea data (removes LM induced diarrhea).

label: Cumulative days of illness surveillance
definition: Cumulative sum of days where illness surveillance data was recorded for the participant. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Cumulative sum of days followed (with surveillance data). Calculated. General surveillance data

label: Cumulative days with ALRI
definition: Cumulative count of days where ALRI was identified since beginning of follow-up. Days when data are missing were classified as ALRI-free. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Cumulative number of days when ALRI was identified. calculated, ALRI

label: ALRI diagnosed by medical professional
definition: Whether ALRI was diagnosed by a medical professional. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: REF - diagnosis of ALRI by a medical professional

label: Dehydrating diarrhea diagnosed by medical professional
definition: Whether dehydrating diarrhea was diagnosed by a medical professional. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: REF - diagnosis of dehydrating diarrhea by a medical professional

label: Diarrheal episode status
definition: Whether this day of observation marked the beginning of a diarrheal episode or was within a diarrheal episode. Diarrhea episodes were separated by two diarrhea-free days. Days when data are missing were classified as diarrhea-free (if there were two missing days before a day with diarrhea, the episode started on day with diarrhea). Days with Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M)-induced diarrhea were classified as diarrhea-free. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: 2 at beginning of episode, 1 within episode. Diarrhea episodes are separated by two diarrhea-free days. In this dataset, days when data are missing are thought to be diarrhea-free (so if there are two missing days before a day with diarrhea, the episode s

label: 1st day of diarrheal episode
definition: Whether this is the first day of a diarrheal episode. Diarrhea episodes were separated by two diarrhea-free days. Days when data are missing were classified as diarrhea-free (if there were two missing days before a day with diarrhea, the episode started on day with diarrhea). Days with Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M)-induced diarrhea were classified as diarrhea-free. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: 1 if first day of episode, 0 if not, calculated. General diarrhea data (removes LM induced diarrhea).

label: Malaria diagnosed by medical professional
definition: Whether malaria was diagnosed by a medical professional. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: REF - diagnosis of malaria by a medical professional

label: Initial illness surveillance date
definition: Date at first follow-up for illness surveillance. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Date at first follow up for diarrhea, calculated. General diarrhea data (removes LM induced diarrhea).

label: Final illness surveillance date
definition: Date at last follow-up for illness surveillance. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Date at last follow up for diarrhea, calculated. General diarrhea data (removes LM induced diarrhea).

label: Hospitalized
definition: Whether participant was hospitalized on this day. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: REF - child was hospitalized on this day

label: Age at last illness surveillance (days)
definition: Age (in days) at last follow-up for illness surveillance. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Maximum age followed with SAF data. Calculated. General surveillance data

label: Decreased appetite at episode
definition: Whether the participant's appetite was normal during this diarrheal episode. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: 0 if appetite was normal during episode, 1 if mother reported 'less than normal' appetite. Calculated. Diarrhea episode characteristics.

label: Fever at episode, max temp (C)
definition: Maximum temperature (Celsius) during this diarrheal episode. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Maximum temperature during diarrheal episode. Calculated. Diarrhea episode characteristics.

label: Use of antibiotics, caregiver report
definition: Whether the mother reported any antibiotic usage by the participant. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age.
codebookDescription: Maternal report of antibiotic use, 1=yes, 0=no, original SAF data

label: Antibiotics, caregiver report
definition: Type of antibiotic used by the participant, as reported by the mother. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age.
codebookDescription: 1=penicillin; 2=cephalosporins; 3=sulfonamides; 4=macrolides; 5=tetracyclines; 6=fluoroquinolones; 7=unknown; 8=metronidazole; 9=other, original SAF data

label: Activity level, caregiver report
definition: Participant's activity level, as reported by the mother. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Maternal report of activity level, 0=normal; 1=sleepy; 2=difficult to awaken, original SAF data

label: ALRI, fieldworker assessment
definition: Whether the field worker determined that the participant had ALRI during the surveillance visit. Participants who had a cough or shortness of breath PLUS rapid respiratory rate (defined as: >60 breaths/min in participants aged 0 to <2 months, >50 breaths/min in participants aged 2 to <12 months and >40 breaths/min in participants aged 12 months to three years) were determined to have ALRI and were referred to the nearest health center for assessment and treatment. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Fieldworker assessment of ALRI, 1=yes, 0=no, original SAF data

label: Cough, caregiver report
definition: Whether the mother reported the participant having a cough. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Maternal report of cough, 1=yes, 0=no, original SAF data

label: Diarrhea, caregiver report
definition: Whether the mother reported the participant having diarrhea. This variable was not used in the identification of diarrhea. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Maternal assessment of diarrhea. This was not used in the identification of diarrhea, 1=yes, 0=no, original SAF data

label: Ear pain or pulling, caregiver report
definition: Whether the mother reported any ear pain or pulling by the participant. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Maternal report of ear pain/pulling, 1=yes, 0=no, original SAF data

label: Any illness, caregiver report
definition: Whether the mother reported any illness in the participant. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Maternal report of any illness, 1=yes, 0=no, original SAF data

label: Indrawing, fieldworker assessment
definition: Whether the field worker determined that the participant was experiencing inward movement of the lower chest wall when breathing. The field worker observed the participant for indrawing during the surveillance visit if the mother reported that the participant experienced coughing or shortness of breath yesterday. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age.
codebookDescription: Field worker observation of indrawing, 1=yes, 0=no, original SAF data

label: Appetite, caregiver report
definition: Participant's appetite, as reported by the mother. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Maternal report of appetite, 0=normal; 1=less than normal, original SAF data

label: ORT administered, caregiver report
definition: Whether the mother reported that the participant was given oral rehydration salts (ORS), a pre-packaged ORS liquid, or a government-recommended homemade fluid for oral rehydration therapy (ORT). Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: ORT administrated, 1=yes, 0=no, original SAF data

label: Referral, fieldworker assessment
definition: Whether the field worker referred the participant for medical care during the surveillance visit. The participant was referred to the nearest health center for assessment and treatment if: (i) their temperature was above 39C; (ii) they passed 8 or more loose stools in a 24 hour period; (iii) had blood in their stool; (iv) had severe dehydration; or (v) if the field worker determined that the participant had ALRI. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Referral made by field worker, 1=yes, 0=no, original SAF data

label: Respiratory rate (breaths/min)
definition: Respiratory rate measurement #1 (breaths/min). The field worker measured the participant's respiratory rate during the surveillance visit if the mother reported that the participant experienced coughing or shortness of breath yesterday. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age.
codebookDescription: Respiratory rate #1 0-99, original SAF data

label: Respiratory rate (breaths/min), 2nd
definition: Respiratory rate measurement #2 (breaths/min). The field worker measured the participant's respiratory rate during the surveillance visit if the mother reported that the participant experienced coughing or shortness of breath yesterday. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age.
codebookDescription: Respiratory rate #2 0-99, original SAF data

label: Diarrheal stool collected at visit
definition: Whether a stool sample was collected from the participant during the surveillance visit. Diarrheal stool samples were collected if the participant had diarrhea yesterday (>3 loose stools) AND if no diarrhea sample has been collected for this episode of diarrhea within the past two weeks. Only one diarrhea sample should be collected for each diarrhea episode or, in the case of persistent diarrhea, samples should be taken every two weeks during the extended episode. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Sample collected, 1=yes, 0=no, original SAF data

label: Shortness of breath, caregiver report
definition: Whether the mother reported the participant having a shortness of breath. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Maternal report of shortness of breath, 1=yes, 0=no, original SAF data

label: Temperature (C)
definition: The participant's temperature (in Celsius). The field worker measured the participant's temperature during the surveillance visit if the mother reported that the participant had a fever yesterday. If their temperature was above 39C, the participant was referred to the nearest health center for assessment and treatment. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age.
codebookDescription: temperature (oC) as measured by fieldworker, 0-99.9 C, original SAF data

label: Total ALRI episodes
definition: Total number of distinct ALRI episodes reported. ALRI episodes were separated by 14 ALRI-free days. Days when data were missing were classified as ALRI-free (if there were 14 missing days before a day with ALRI, the episode started on day with ALRI). Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Sum of ALRI episodes. calculated, ALRI

label: Total days with ALRI
definition: Total number of days when ALRI was identified since beginning of follow-up. Days when data were missing were classified as ALRI-free. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Sum of days when ALRI was identified. calculated, ALRI

label: Total days in all ALRI episodes
definition: Total number of days that fall within any ALRI episode since beginning of follow-up. ALRI episodes were separated by 14 ALRI-free days. Days when data were missing were classified as ALRI-free (if there were 14 missing days before a day with ALRI, the episode started on day with ALRI). Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Sum of days in ALRI episode (episodes separated by 14 ALRI-'free' days). calculated, ALRI

label: Total days in all diarrheal episodes, ex 1st days
definition: Total number of days that fall within any diarrheal episode during follow-up, excluding the first day of each diarrheal episode. To calculate the time at risk for a new diarrheal episode, subtract 'Total days in all diarrheal episodes' from 'Total diarrheal surveillance days.' Diarrhea episodes were separated by two diarrhea-free days. Days when data were missing were classified as diarrhea-free (if there were two missing days before a day with diarrhea, the episode started on day with diarrhea). Days with Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M)-induced diarrhea were classified as diarrhea-free. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Sum of days spent in diarrheal episodes, without including first day of episodes (used to subtract from sumsurv for the incidence denominator  time at risk for a new diarrheal episode), calculated. General diarrhea data (removes LM induced diarrhea).

label: Total days in all diarrheal episodes
definition: Total number of days that fall within any diarrheal episode since beginning of follow-up. Diarrhea episodes were separated by two diarrhea-free days. Days when data were missing were classified as diarrhea-free (if there were two missing days before a day with diarrhea, the episode started on day with diarrhea). Days with Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M)-induced diarrhea were classified as diarrhea-free. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Total number of days with diarrhea (sum of dprev3), calculated. General diarrhea data (removes LM induced diarrhea).

label: Total diarrheal episodes
definition: Total number of distinct diarrheal episodes reported. Diarrhea episodes were separated by two diarrhea-free days. Days when data were missing were classified as diarrhea-free (if there were two missing days before a day with diarrhea, the episode started on day with diarrhea). Days with Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M)-induced diarrhea were classified as diarrhea-free. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Total number of distinct episodes reported (sum of dint3), calculated. General diarrhea data (removes LM induced diarrhea).

label: Total fever days, caregiver report
definition: Total number of days when fever was reported by the mother since beginning of follow-up. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Sum of days when fever was reported by the mother. calculated, ALRI

label: Days with decreased appetite at episode
definition: Total number of days with decreased appetite during this diarrheal episode. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Total number of days with decreased appetite during episode. Calculated. Diarrhea episode characteristics.

label: Total illness surveillance days with data
definition: Total number of days where illness surveillance data was recorded for the participant. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Sum of days with data (where diar~=.). Calculated. General surveillance data

label: Total illness surveillance days
definition: Total time (in days) that the participant was followed for illness surveillance. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Time followed (exitdiar-entrydiar). Calculated. General surveillance data

label: Days between diarrheal episodes
definition: Days until the next diarrheal episode starts (missing indicates time from last episode to end of follow-up, or from birth if the participant never had diarrhea during the follow-up period). Diarrhea episodes were separated by two diarrhea-free days. Days when data are missing were classified as diarrhea-free (if there were two missing days before a day with diarrhea, the episode started on day with diarrhea). Days with Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M)-induced diarrhea were classified as diarrhea-free. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Days until next diarrhea starts (missing indicates time from last episode to end of follow up (or from birth if no diarrhea)), calculated. General diarrhea data (removes LM induced diarrhea).

label: Illness surveillance data present today
definition: Whether symptom data was available for this day of observation. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: 0 if no symptom data are available for this day (missing) and 1 if symptom data are available, calculated

label: Adjusted lactulose excreted (mg)
definition: Lactulose excreted (mg), recalculated based on the adjusted lactulose concentration. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Adjusted lactulose (mmol/L)
definition: Lactulose (mmol/L), adjusted using the between-lab correction factor. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Adjusted lactulose excreted (%)
definition: Percent of lactulose excreted, recalculated based on the adjusted lactulose concentration. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Adjusted L:M excretion ratio
definition: Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) excretion ratio, adjusted using the between-lab correction factor. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Adjusted mannitol excreted (mg)
definition: Mannitol excreted (mg), recalculated based on the adjusted mannitol concentration. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Adjusted mannitol (mmol/L)
definition: Mannitol (mmol/L), adjusted using the between-lab correction factor. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Adjusted mannitol excreted (%)
definition: Percent of mannitol excreted, recalculated based on the adjusted mannitol concentration. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Age at last contact (days)
definition: Age (in days) of last contact for participants lost to follow-up.
codebookDescription: age in days at date of last contact. Source=.

label: Lactulose dosage (mg)
definition: Total lactulose given (mg), from a Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) solution containing 250mg/L lactulose in a dose of 2mL/kg weight or 20mL maximum. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Mannitol dosage (mg)
definition: Total mannitol given (mg), from a Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) solution containing 50mg/L mannitol in a dose of 2mL/kg weight or 20mL maximum. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Sample analysis date
definition: Date urine sample underwent Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) analysis by the laboratory. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Duration of urine collection (hrs)
definition: Number of hours to collect Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) urine. The protocol specified that urine should be collected for 5 hours after ingestion of the Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) solution. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: L:M analysis lab
definition: Laboratory that conducted the Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) HPLC assay. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Adjusted lactulose excreted (%) greater than 90th percentile in Brazil
definition: Brazil data represented the least abnormal gut permeability values. Since there was a small sample size, extreme values could not be transformed into z-scores with precision. All values above the 90th percentile were indicated here. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Greater than 100% lactulose excreted
definition: Flag for Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) urine samples where more than 100% of the recorded lactulose dose given to the participant was excreted. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Adjusted L:M excretion ratio greater than 90th percentile in Brazil
definition: Brazil data represented the least abnormal gut permeability values. Since there was a small sample size, extreme values could not be transformed into z-scores with precision. All values above the 90th percentile were indicated here. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Adjusted mannitol excreted (%) greater than 90th percentile in Brazil
definition: Brazil data represented the least abnormal gut permeability values. Since there was a small sample size, extreme values could not be transformed into z-scores with precision. All values above the 90th percentile were indicated here. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Greater than 100% mannitol excreted
definition: Flag for Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) urine samples where more than 100% of the recorded mannitol dose given to the participant was excreted. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Last contact date
definition: Date of last contact for participants lost to follow-up.
codebookDescription: date of last contact with MAL-ED study. Source=PIDs. ..

label: Lactulose not detected
definition: Flag for Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) urine samples in which no mannitol peak was detected by HPLC. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Mannitol not detected
definition: Flag for Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) urine samples in which no lactulose peak was detected by HPLC. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Incorrect dose of L:M solution
definition: Flag for Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) urine samples that were collected from participants who were administered an incorrect dosage of the Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) solution. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.
codebookValues: , CHILD TOOK ONLY 6ML OF LM. HAD ALLERGY TO THE SOLUTION W/PDF, DOSAGE BASED ON PRIOR MONTH'S WEIGHT, W/PDF, INCORRECT DOSAGE ADMINISTERED (21.86ML INSTEAD OF 20ML) W/PDF

label: Urine included in L:M analysis
definition: Flag for Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) urine samples that were excluded from analysis. Reasons for exclusion include (i) if either lactulose or mannitol were not detected, (ii) if either lactulose or mannitol excretion was more than 100% of the dosage, (iii) if the duration of urine collection was either less than 4.5 hours or more than 5.5 hours, or (iv) if there was some other known issue with the sample. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Urine collected in 14 day window
definition: Whether the Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) urine sample was collected within a +/- 14 day window. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Urine collected in 30 day window
definition: Whether the Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) urine sample was collected within a +/- 30 day window. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Duration of urine collection greater than 5.5 hrs
definition: Flag for Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) urine samples that were collected for more than 5.5 hours. The protocol specified that urine should be collected for 5 hours after ingestion of the Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) solution. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Duration of urine collection less than 4.5 hrs
definition: Flag for Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) urine samples that were collected for less than 4.5 hours.The protocol specified that urine should be collected for 5 hours after ingestion of the Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) solution. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Lactulose z-score
definition: Lactulose z-score, using values adjusted by the between-lab correction factor. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: L:M excretion ratio z-score
definition: Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) excretion ratio z-score, using values adjusted by the between-lab correction factor. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: Mannitol z-score
definition: Mannitol z-score, using values adjusted by the between-lab correction factor. The Lactulose:Mannitol dual sugar test for gut permeability was used for analysis of environmental enteropathy and was assessed in urine samples collected at 3, 6, 9, and 15 months of age.

label: EAEC aatA-pos and aaiC-pos, by PCR
codebookDescription: Presence of AATA and AAIC E.coli virulence genes. presence of AATA and AAIC. Source=Calculated. 1=yes;0=no

parentLabel: Virulence factor genes aatA and aaiC aggregate data
label: Cumulative sum aaiC-pos and aatA-pos stools
definition: Cumulative sum of stool samples positive for aaiC and aatA (Escherichia coli virulence genes) by PCR to date per participant. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on the first stool sample collected during each diarrheal episode until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age) and on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).
codebookDescription: cumulative count of the number of positive aata + aaic samples by PID. . Source=Calculated. continuous numeric

parentLabel: Virulence factor genes aatA and aaiC aggregate data
label: Cumulative sum aaiC-pos and aatA-pos 1st diarrheal stools
definition: Cumulative sum of first diarrheal stool samples positive for aaiC and aatA (Escherichia coli virulence genes) by PCR to date per participant. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on the first stool sample collected during each diarrheal episode until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age).
codebookDescription: cumulative count of the number of positive aata + aaic samples by PID in first diarrhea stools. . Source=Calculated. continuous numeric

codebookDescription: cumulative count of the number of positive aata + aaic samples by PID in first monthly stools. . Source=Calculated. continuous numeric

label: Atypical EPEC, by PCR
codebookDescription: atypical EPEC?. presence of EAE alone (without BFPA, STX1, or STX2). Source=Calculated. 1=yes;0=no

label: Cumulative sum atypical EPEC-pos stools
definition: Cumulative sum of stool samples positive for atypical Enteropathogenic Escherichia coli (EPEC) by PCR to date per participant. Atypical EPEC was defined as the presence of the eae virulence gene alone (in the absence of bfpA, stx1, or stx2). Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on the first stool sample collected during each diarrheal episode until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age) and on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).

label: Cumulative sum atypical EPEC-pos 1st diarrheal stools
definition: Cumulative sum of first diarrheal stool samples positive for atypical Enteropathogenic Escherichia coli (EPEC) by PCR to date per participant. Atypical EPEC was defined as the presence of the eae virulence gene alone (in the absence of bfpA, stx1, or stx2). Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on the first stool sample collected during each diarrheal episode until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age).
codebookDescription: cumulative count of the number of positive atypical EPEC samples by PID in first diarrhea stools. . Source=Calculated. continuous numeric

label: Cumulative sum atypical EPEC-pos 1st monthly stools

Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).
codebookDescription: cumulative count of the number of positive atypical EPEC samples by PID in first monthly stools. . Source=Calculated. continuous numeric

codebookDescription: Did this stool sample have bacteria detected?. if aeromonas =1 or campy =1 or eaec=1 or eiec=1 or atypicalepec =1 or epec =1 or Lt_etec=1 or st_etec=1 or pshigyn=1 or salmonella =1 or shigella=1 or stec=1 or vibrio=1 or yenteryn=1 then bacteria=1;else bacteria=0;. label: Bacteriology testing completed
definition: Whether this stool sample underwent all bacteriology tests. Stool samples must have a completed Campylobacter ELISA test in addition to culture for Salmonella, Shigella, Vibrio, Yersinia, Aeromonas, and Plesiomonas for bacteriology testing to be considered complete. After culture, suspicious colonies were screened by biochemical tests to identify bacterial species. All presumptive Salmonella, Shigella, and Vibrio were confirmed by serotyping. Yersinia, Aeromonas, and Plesiomonas were confirmed by supplemental biochemical tests. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on the first stool sample collected during each diarrheal episode until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age) and on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).

Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on the first stool sample collected during each diarrheal episode until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age).

Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on the first stool sample collected during each diarrheal episode until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age).

parentLabel: Complete testing of monthly stool samples
label: Completely tested monthly stool (ex time zero stools)
definition: Whether this stool was an asymptomatic monthly sample and was completely tested. Time zero stools, which were an optional collection for archive purposes only, were NOT considered. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).

parentLabel: Complete testing of monthly stool samples
label: Completely tested monthly stool (ex archived, time zero stools)
definition: Whether this stool was an asymptomatic monthly sample and was completely tested. Archive-only stools and time zero stools, which were an optional collection for archive purposes only, were NOT considered. This variable was used to identify samples for monthly stool analyses. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).

parentLabel: Complete testing of monthly stool samples
label: Completely tested monthly stool (ex microscopy)
definition: Whether this stool was an asymptomatic monthly sample and was completely tested, without consideration of microscopy or modified acid fast stains. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).

parentLabel: Complete testing of monthly stool samples
label: Completely tested monthly stool (ex archived, time zero stools, ex microscopy)
definition: Whether this stool was an asymptomatic monthly sample and was completely tested, without consideration of microscopy or modified acid fast stains. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).

label: Cryptosporidium, by ELISA
codebookDescription: Was cryptosporidium detected by ELISA (collapsed)?. Use this variable for cryptosporidium for analysis. Indeterminate test result is coded as no.. Source=Calculated. 1=yes;0=no

label: Cumulative sum Cryptosporidium-pos stools, by ELISA
definition: Cumulative sum of stool samples positive for Cryptosporidium by ELISA to date per participant. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on the first stool sample collected during each diarrheal episode until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age) and on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).
codebookDescription: cumulative count of the number of positive cryptosporidium samples by PID. . Source=Calculated. continuous numeric

Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on the first stool sample collected during each diarrheal episode until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age).
codebookDescription: cumulative count of the number of positive cryptosporidium samples by PID in first diarrhea stools. . Source=Calculated. continuous numeric

parentLabel: Complete testing of diarrheal stool samples

definition: Whether this is the first diarrheal stool sample collected in an episode with complete microbiology testing. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on diarrheal stool samples collected until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age).

label: Cumulative completely tested 1st diarrheal stool count
definition: Cumulative count of the number of first diarrheal stool samples with complete microbiology testing per participant to date. codebookDescription: The number of completely tested first diarrhea stool samples for a specific child.. . Source=Calculated. ##

label: Diarrheal stool collection #
definition: The Nth stool collected in a specific diarrheal episode, regardless of protocol Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Diarrheal stool samples were collected until 36 months of age.

label: EAEC aatA-pos or aaiC-pos, by PCR

Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on the first stool sample collected during each diarrheal episode until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age) and on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).

label: Monthly archive only stool
definition: Whether this stool sample was a monthly asymptomatic collection for archive only. First monthly asymptomatic samples collected at 13-14, 16-17, 19-20, 22-23 and 25-36 months of age were for archive.

label: Lost to follow-up within 14 days of stool collection
definition: Whether the participant was lost to follow-up, but the length of time with surveillance data before or after stool collection was less than 14 days. This variable determines whether there was sufficient follow-up to create 'Stool type, 14 day window,' an alternative stool type definition. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode.
codebookDescription: Is length of time with surveillance data before or after stool collection less than 14 days? . Is there sufficient follow-up to create alternate stool type definitions? , e.g. stooltype14. Source=Calculated. 1=yes;0=no

label: Lost to follow-up within 28 days of stool collection
definition: Whether the participant was lost to follow-up, but the length of time with surveillance data before or after stool collection was less than 28 days. This variable determines whether there was sufficient follow-up to create 'Stool type, 28 day window,' an alternative stool type definition. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode.
codebookDescription: Is length of time with surveilllance data before or after stool collection less than 28 days? . Is there sufficient follow-up to create alternate stool type definitions?, e.g. stooltype28. Source=Calculated. 1=yes;0=no

label: Lost to follow-up within 7 days of stool collection
definition: Whether the participant was lost to follow-up, but the length of time with surveillance data before or after stool collection was less than 7 days. This variable determines whether there was sufficient follow-up to create 'Stool type, 7 day window,' an alternative stool type definition. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode.
codebookDescription: Is length of time with surveillance before or after stool collection less than 7 days? . Is there sufficient follow-up to create alternate stool type definitions?, e.g. stooltype7. Source=Calculated. 1=yes;0=no

label: Incomplete follow-up
definition: Whether the participant was lost to follow-up and a non-continuation form was completed to collect information about the reason for leaving the study.
codebookDescription: Was a NCF completed for this child?. Used to flag children with incomplete follow-up. Source=Calculated. 1=yes;0=no

label: Diarrheal stool classified by illness surveillance
definition: Whether no diarrhea was reported on the day of stool collection, but diarrhea was reported within 2 days of collection. Samples meeting this criteria were classified as diarrheal stools. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Was information using lastdiar and untildiar from illness file used to determine diarrhea stool type? . No diarrhea was reported the day of stool collection, but diarrhea was reported within 2 days of diarrhea collection, therefore stool sample was classified as a diarrhea sample. . Source=Calculated. 1=yes;0=no

label: Norovirus cohort participant
definition: Whether the participant was randomly chosen to have their monthly stool samples tested for Norovirus. 10% of all participants followed for at least 6 months at each site were selected to have their monthly stools tested for Norovirus.
codebookDescription: Was this PID randomly chosen to have monthly stools tested for norovirus? Used to identify PIDs in Norovirus cohort.. 10% of all children followed for at least 6 months at each site were selected to have monthly stools tested for norovirus. Source=Calculated. 1=yes;0=no

label: Quantity not sufficient
definition: Flag for monthly asymptomatic and diarrheal stool samples where the quantity collected was not sufficient (defined as less than 2 grams for monthly archive-only stools, and less than 4 grams for all other monthly and diarrheal stools). Recollection was requested for stool samples with insufficient quantities. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age. First monthly asymptomatic samples collected at 13-14, 16-17, 19-20, 22-23 and 25-36 months of age were for archive only.

label: Rotavirus-pos within 28 days of vaccination, by ELISA
definition: Flag for whether the Rotavirus test result changed after Rotavirus vaccination. Any positive Rotavirus test result within 28 days of Rotavirus vaccination was changed to be a negative result. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on the first stool sample collected during each diarrheal episode until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age) and on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).
codebookDescription: Did the rotavirus test result change after incorporating information regarding rotavirus vaccination status?. Any positive rotavirus test result within 28 days of rotavirus vaccination was changed to be a negative result. Source=Calculated. 1=yes;0=no

label: Stool collected 1 day after surveillance ended
definition: Flag for whether the stool sample was collected one day after surveillance ended. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on the first stool sample collected during each diarrheal episode until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age) and on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).
codebookDescription: Was the stool sample collected one day after surveillance ended?. Please see dataset notes for more discussion. Stool sample collected one day after information from SAF ended.. Source=Calculated. 1=yes;0=no

label: Time zero stool
definition: Whether this stool sample is a non-diarrhea stool sample collected less than or equal to 25 days from the participant's date of birth.

Added the response category of ''00'' for those samples which had a positive test result but stool collection occurred less than 28 days from rotavirus vaccination; these samples are deemed negative for rotavirus..
