label: Norovirus testing completed
definition: Whether Norovirus testing was completed for this stool sample. Requires RT-PCR to have been performed. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on the first stool sample collected during each diarrheal episode until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age) and on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).

label: Stool test count
definition: Number of microbiology tests performed on this stool sample, including bacteriology culture; ELISAs for Campylobacter, Cryptosporidium, Giardia, Entamoeba histolytica, Adenovirus, Astrovirus, and Rotavirus; RT-PCR for Norovirus; PCR for Escherichia coli; wet prep microscopy (direct and concentrate); and modified acid fast stain microscopy. Note: E. coli PCR was not necessary if E. coli was not found in culture; however, E. coli PCR was still considered to be performed to determine the number of tests performed on the stool sample. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on the first stool sample collected during each diarrheal episode until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age) and on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).
codebookDescription: number of microbiology tests performed on this specific stool sample. uses information from the FVF, ECP, BDF, MDF, NRV, PEF forms to determine number of tests performed on stool sample. If e. coli was not found in culture and therefore PCR was not necessary, e.coli PCR was still considered to be performed to determine number of tests. Repeat tests performed on initial and recollection stool samples are not counted twice.. Source=Calculated. continous numeric

Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on diarrheal stool samples collected until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age) and on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).

label: Protozoa ELISA testing completed
definition: Whether protozoal ELISA testing was completed (defined as having ELISA tests for Cryptosporidium, Entamoeba histolytica, and Giardia completed) for this stool sample. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on diarrheal stool samples collected until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age) and on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).

label: Persistent diarrheal episode (more than 14 days)
definition: Whether the diarrhea episode was persistent, defined in the MAL-ED study as lasting more than 14 days in duration. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Is diarrhea persistent, lasting greater than 14 days?. Information from illness dataset:  If Dur>14, then persistent =1, else persistent =0. Source=PID. 1=yes;0=no

label: Stool type, physiologic
definition: Type of stool type collected, using information from surveillance. 'Diarrhea stools' were samples with a liquid or watery consistency where diarrhea was reported within +/- 2 days of stool collection. 'Monthly stools' were collected more than 2 days away from an episode of study-defined diarrhea. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on diarrheal stool samples collected until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age) and on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).
codebookDescription: Type of stool sample collected. Using information from surveillance. Diarrhea stool = diarrhea reported within +/- 2 days from stool collection plus having a liquid or watery consistency. Monthly stool is stool collected more than 2 days away from study defined diarrhea. Source=Calculated. m1 =monthly; d1=diarrhea stool with watery or liquid consistency

label: Prolonged diarrheal episode (7 to 14 days)
definition: Whether the diarrhea episode was prolonged, defined in the MAL-ED study as lasting between 7-14 days in duration. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Was the diarrhea episode a prolonged episode?. Information from illness dataset: If 7<=dur<=14 then prolonged =1, else prolonged =0. Source=illnessfull.csv. 1=yes;0=no

label: Per protocol diarrheal stool collection
definition: Whether this diarrheal stool sample was collected per the MAL-ED study protocol. Per protocol diarrheal stools included samples collected before the end of each diarrheal episode (whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day) as well as additional stool samples collected for a specific diarrhea episode after 14 study-defined diarrhea days in the same episode. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Diarrheal stool samples were collected until 36 months of age.

label: Cumulative per protocol diarrheal stool count
definition: Cumulative count of the number of stool samples collected per the MAL-ED study protocol to date. Per protocol diarrheal stools included samples collected before the end of each diarrheal episode (whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day) as well as additional stool samples collected for a specific diarrhea episode after 14 study-defined diarrhea days in the same episode. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Diarrheal stool samples were collected until 36 months of age.

label: Cumulative stool count
definition: Cumulative count of the number of all first asymptomatic monthly stool samples for each month of surveillance (all '1st monthly stool') and all first diarrheal stool samples for each diarrheal episode (all '1st diarrheal stool') to date. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Diarrheal stool samples were collected until 36 months of age.

parentLabel: Shigatoxin producing Escherichia coli (STEC) aggregate data
label: Cumulative sum STEC-pos 1st monthly stools
definition: Cumulative sum of first monthly asymptomatic stool samples positive for Shiga toxin-producing Escherichia coli (STEC), as defined by the presence of stx1 or stx2 (E. coli virulence genes) by PCR, to date per participant. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).
codebookDescription: cumulative count of the number of positive STEC samples by PID in first monthly stools. . Source=Calculated. continuous numeric

label: 1st diarrheal stool
definition: Whether this was the first diarrheal stool sample collected for a specific diarrheal episode. Note: most analyses used only the first diarrheal stool sample collected for a specific episode and not additional per-protocol diarrheal samples collected after 14 days of study-defined diarrhea. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on the first stool sample collected during each diarrheal episode until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age).

label: Cumulative 1st diarrheal stool count
definition: Cumulative count of the number of first diarrheal stool sample collected for specific diarrheal episodes to date. Note: most analyses used only the first diarrheal stool sample collected for a specific episode and not additional per-protocol diarrheal samples collected after 14 days of study-defined diarrhea. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on the first stool sample collected during each diarrheal episode until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age).

label: 1st monthly stool
definition: Whether this was the first monthly asymptomatic stool sample collected for this particular month of study, including archive-only stools. Note: most analyses used only the first asymptomatic monthly stool sample collected for each month and not additional per-protocol monthly sample collections. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age). First monthly asymptomatic samples collected at 13-14, 16-17, 19-20, 22-23 and 25-36 months of age were for archive.

label: Cumulative 1st monthly stool count
definition: Cumulative count of the number of first monthly asymptomatic stool sample collected for this particular month of study to date, including archive-only stools. Note: most analyses used only the first asymptomatic monthly stool sample collected for each month and not additional per-protocol monthly sample collections. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age). First monthly asymptomatic samples collected at 13-14, 16-17, 19-20, 22-23 and 25-36 months of age were for archive.

label: Stool type, 14 day window
definition: Type of stool type collected, using information from surveillance. 'Diarrhea stools' were samples where diarrhea was reported within +/- 2 days of stool collection. 'Monthly stools' were collected more than 14 days away from an episode of study-defined diarrhea. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on diarrheal stool samples collected until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age) and on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).
codebookDescription: Type of stool sample collected. Using information from surveillance. Diarrhea stool = diarrhea reported within +/- 2 days from stool collection. Monthly stool is stool collected more than 14 days away from study defined diarrhea. Source=Calculated. m1 =monthly; d1=diarrhea

label: Stool type, 28 day window
definition: Type of stool type collected, using information from surveillance. 'Diarrhea stools' were samples where diarrhea was reported within +/- 2 days of stool collection. 'Monthly stools' were collected more than 28 days away from an episode of study-defined diarrhea. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on diarrheal stool samples collected until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age) and on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).
codebookDescription: Type of stool sample collected. Using information from surveillance. Diarrhea stool = diarrhea reported within +/- 2 days from stool collection. Monthly stool is stool collected more than 28 days away from study defined diarrhea. Source=Calculated. m1 =monthly; d1=diarrhea

label: Stool type, 7 day window
definition: Type of stool type collected, using information from surveillance. 'Diarrhea stools' were samples where diarrhea was reported within +/- 2 days of stool collection. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on diarrheal stool samples collected until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age) and on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).
codebookDescription: Type of stool sample collected. Using information from surveillance. Diarrhea stool = diarrhea reported within +/- 2 days from stool collection. Monthly stool is stool collected more than 7 days away from study defined diarrhea. Source=Calculated. m1 =monthly; d1=diarrhea

label: Stool collected in target window
definition: Whether the first monthly asymptomatic stool sample (as defined by 'Stool type, physiologic') was collected within -2 to +7 day target window from the birthdate anniversary. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age.
codebookDescription: Was the monthly stool collected within desired window of collection (-2/+7 days from DOB anniversary). . Source=Calculated. 1=yes;0=no

label: Bacteria species count
definition: Sum of all bacteria species ('Aeromonas, by bacteriology;' 'Campylobacter, by ELISA;' 'EAEC aatA-pos or aaiC-pos, by PCR;' 'EIEC ipaH-pos, by PCR;' 'Atypical EPEC, by PCR;' 'EPEC eae-pos and bfpA-pos, by PCR;' 'ETEC LT-pos ST-neg, by PCR;' 'ETEC ST-pos, by PCR;' 'STEC stx1-pos or stx2-pos, by PCR;' 'Plesiomonas shigelloides, by bacteriology;' 'Salmonella, by bacteriology;' 'Shigella, by bacteriology;' and 'Vibrio, by bacteriology') identified in this specific stool sample. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on the first stool sample collected during each diarrheal episode until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age) and on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).
codebookDescription: Sum of all bacteria identified in a specific stool sample. sum (of aeromonas campy eaec eiec atypicalepec epec lt_etec st_etc pshigyn salmonella shigella stec vibrio yenteryn). Source=Calculated. continuous numeric

parentLabel: Aggregate data for bacteria detection in stool
label: Cumulative sum bacteria species in stools
definition: Cumulative sum of bacteria ('Aeromonas, by bacteriology;' 'Campylobacter, by ELISA;' 'EAEC aatA-pos or aaiC-pos, by PCR;' 'EIEC ipaH-pos, by PCR;' 'Atypical EPEC, by PCR;' 'EPEC eae-pos and bfpA-pos, by PCR;' 'ETEC LT-pos ST-neg, by PCR;' 'ETEC ST-pos, by PCR;' 'STEC stx1-pos or stx2-pos, by PCR;' 'Plesiomonas shigelloides, by bacteriology;' 'Salmonella, by bacteriology;' 'Shigella, by bacteriology;' and 'Vibrio, by bacteriology') identified per participant in all stool samples to date. Complete testing of stool samples is required to calculate this variable. Includes information from first monthly asymptomatic stools collected for each month and first diarrheal stools collected for each diarrheal episode. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on diarrheal stool samples collected until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age) and on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).

label: Max dehydration categorization
definition: Categorization of the maximum severity of dehydration that occurred during this diarrheal episode. Used to calculate 'Combined Vesikari and Clark severity at episode.' Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Maximum dehydration score. From illness dataset. Source=illnessfull.csv. 2= some dehydration; 3= severe dehydration reported during diarrhea episode | Maximum dehydration score (2: some dehydration; 3: severe dehydration reported during diarrhea episode). Calculated. Diarrhea episode characteristics.

label: Diarrheal episode #
definition: All days of observation that fall within a diarrheal episode were coded with the cumulative diarrheal episode count. Diarrhea episodes were separated by two diarrhea-free days. Days with missing data were classified as diarrhea-free (if there were two missing days before a day with diarrhea, the episode started on day with diarrhea). Days with Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M)-induced diarrhea were classified as diarrhea-free. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: All days in episode coded with number of episode. From illness dataset. Source=CAF. ## | All days in episode coded with number of episode, calculated. General diarrhea data (removes LM induced diarrhea).

label: Diarrheal episode duration (days)
definition: Duration of the diarrheal episode, in days. Diarrhea episodes were separated by two diarrhea-free days. Days with missing data were classified as diarrhea-free (if there were two missing days before a day with diarrhea, the episode started on day with diarrhea). Days with Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M)-induced diarrhea were classified as diarrhea-free. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Duration of episode, calculated. General diarrhea data (removes LM induced diarrhea). | Duration of episode. From illness dataset. Source=illnessfull.csv. ##

label: Diarrhea duration categorization
definition: Categorization of the number of days this diarrheal episode lasted. Used to calculate 'Combined Vesikari and Clark severity at episode.' Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Duration of episode score (1: 2-4 days; 2: 5-7 days; 3: 8+ days). Calculated. Diarrhea episode characteristics. | Duration of episode score. From illness dataset. Source=illnessfull.csv. 1= 2-4 days; 2= 5-7 days; 3= 8+ days

label: Fever at episode, more than 37.5C
definition: Whether the maximum temperature (Celsius) reported during this diarrheal episode was <37.5 (the Integrated Management of Childhood Illness (IMCI) fever definition). Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: 0 if maximum temperature reported during episode was <37.5, 1 if temperature >37.5 was reported during episode (IMCI fever definintion). Calculated. Diarrhea episode characteristics. | Maximum fever during a diarrhea episode. From illness dataset. Source=illnessfull.csv. 0 if maximum temperature reported during episode was <37.5, 1 if temperature >37.5 was reported during episode (imci fever definition)

label: Moderate-to-severe diarrhea by GEMS criteria
definition: Whether the GEMS definition of moderate-to-severe diarrhea was met during this diarrheal episode. The GEMS definition was met when the diarrheal episode was accompanied by any of the following: some or severe dehydration, dysentery (blood reported by mother in stool), hospitalization for diarrhea. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: GEMS definition of moderate/severe diarrhea episode - Episode accompanied by any of the following: Some or severe dehydration, dysentery (blood reported by mother in stool), hospitalization for diarrhea. label: Combined Vesikari and Clark severity at episode
definition: Combination of Vesikari and Clark severity scales, calculated by summing 'Diarrhea duration level,' 'Max loose stools per day, level,' 'Days with vomiting at episode, level,' 'Max dehydration level at episode,' and 'Fever at episode.' label: Cumulative days in this diarrheal episode
definition: Cumulative count of days that fell within the current diarrheal episode. Diarrhea episodes were separated by two diarrhea-free days. Days with missing data were classified as diarrhea-free (if there were two missing days before a day with diarrhea, the episode started on day with diarrhea). Days with Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M)-induced diarrhea were classified as diarrhea-free. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Day of diarrheal episode, calculated. General diarrhea data (removes LM induced diarrhea). | Day of diarrhea episode. From illness dataset. Source=illnessfull.csv. ##

label: Study-defined diarrhea
definition: Whether the participant had diarrhea on this day of observation, defined in the MAL-ED study as having more than 2 loose stools in the day or, if there was blood in the stool, having 1-2 loose stools in the day. Since Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) causes loose stools, days with Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M)-induced diarrhea (where the participant met the definition of diarrhea but had an Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) test on that day or the previous day) were not classified as study-defined diarrhea. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Binary variable that indicates whether or not child had study-defined diarrhea. From illness dataset. Days when the study definition is met, but there was an LM test that day or the previous day, were set to 0 (not 'diarrhea' since LM has been found to cause loose stools).. label: Dehydration, caregiver report
definition: Participant's dehydration level, as reported by the mother. No dehydration was defined as: non-sunken eyes, no lethargy, easily consoled if irritable, drinks or breastfeeds well, normal abdominal skin pinch. Some dehydration was defined as: irritable/difficult to console, delay in skin pinch return, eyes sunken, when offered liquid drinks eagerly/demonstrates greater than normal thirst. Severe dehydration was defined as: lethargy, sunken eyes, listless, difficulty in mother/child interaction. If the mother reported severe dehydration, the participant was referred to the nearest health center for assessment and treatment. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Maternal report of dehydration (None=0, Some=1, Severe=2), original SAF data | Was children dehydrated? Maternal report of dehydration. From illness dataset. Source=illnessfull.csv. 1=yes;0=no

label: Results from all gut inflammation tests available
definition: Whether results from alpha-1-antitrypsin, myeloperoxidase, and neopterin gut inflammation biomarker tests are available for the stool sample. To be included in the gut function analysis set used in PMID: 28396264, results from all 3 biomarker tests must be available. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age were included in analyses of gut function.
codebookDescription: 1= if conc.mpo, conc.neo, & conc.ala have values. Source=calculated.

label: Alpha-1-antitrypsin (mg/g)
definition: Final alpha-1-antitrypsin concentration (mg/g) in the stool sample, a gut inflammation biomarker used for analysis of environmental enteropathy. Alpha-1-antitrypsin indicates protein loss and intestinal permeability. Data from this variable was used in PMID: 28396264. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age were included in analyses of gut function.
codebookDescription: final ALA concentration (mg/g). Source=calculated. use this for analysis (accounts for initial and recollection stools)

label: Myeloperoxidase (ng/mL)
definition: Final myeloperoxidase (ng/mL) concentration in the stool sample, a gut inflammation biomarker used for analysis of environmental enteropathy. Myeloperoxidase reflects neutrophil activity in the intestinal mucosa. Data from this variable was used in PMID: 28396264. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age were included in analyses of gut function.
codebookDescription: final MPO concentration (ng/mL). Source=calculated. use this for analysis (accounts for initial and recollection stools)

label: Neopterin (nmol/L)
definition: Final neopterin (nmol/L) concentration in the stool sample, a gut inflammation biomarker used for analysis of environmental enteropathy. Neopterin indicates T-helper cell 1 activity. Data from this variable was used in PMID: 28396264. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age were included in analyses of gut function.
codebookDescription: final NEO concentration (nmol/L). Source=calculated. use this for analysis (accounts for initial and recollection stools)

label: Diarrheal stool
definition: Whether this stool sample was considered a diarrheal stool by the MAL-ED Gut Function Technical Subcommittee. Stools that were collected on a day that falls within a diarrheal episode or where the last diarrheal episode ended less than or equal to 7 days ago met this definition. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age were included in analyses of gut function.
codebookDescription: 1 if considered a diarrhea stool (dprev3=1 or 1<= lastdiar <=7) ; 0 otherwise . Source=calculated.

label: Stool used for environmental enteropathy analysis
definition: Indicator to select the gut function analysis set of stool samples used in PMID: 28396264. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age were included in analyses of gut function.
codebookDescription: indicator variable 1 if the first stool for a given child/month; NA otherwise; used to select analysis set. Source=calculated.

label: Moderate-to-severe diarrhea by GEMS criteria within 2 days of stool collection
definition: Whether the participant met the GEMS definition of moderate-to-severe diarrhea within -/+ 2 days of stool collection. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age were included in analyses of gut function.
codebookDescription: GEMS definition of moderate/severe diarrhea for diarrhea days within +/2 days of stool collection. Source=illnessfull.

label: L:M excretion test 1 day before stool collection
definition: Flag if the lactulose:mannitol test was given the day of or the day before the date of stool collection. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples should not have been collected within 48hrs after administration of the Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M) solution as it interferes with the gut inflammation biomarker assays. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age were included in analyses of gut function.
codebookDescription: indicator if lactulose:mannitol test given the day of or the day before the date of stool collection. Source=UCF. 1= lm test done day of or day before; na=no proximate lm test

label: Alpha-1-antitrypsin (natural log, mg/g)
definition: Natural log of [alpha-1-antitrypsin (mg/g) + 0.000001] concentration in the stool sample, a gut inflammation biomarker used for analysis of environmental enteropathy. Alpha-1-antitrypsin indicates protein loss and intestinal permeability. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age were included in analyses of gut function.
codebookDescription: log2 (conc.ala+0.000001). Source=calculated.

label: Myeloperoxidase (natural log, ng/mL)
definition: Natural log of [myeloperoxidase (ng/mL) + 0.000001] concentration in the stool sample, a gut inflammation biomarker used for analysis of environmental enteropathy. Myeloperoxidase reflects neutrophil activity in the intestinal mucosa. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age were included in analyses of gut function.
codebookDescription: log2 (conc.mpo+0.000001). Source=calculated.

label: Neopterin (natural log, nmol/L)
definition: Natural log of [neopterin (nmol/L) + 0.000001] concentration in the stool sample, a gut inflammation biomarker used for analysis of environmental enteropathy. Neopterin indicates T-helper cell 1 activity. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age were included in analyses of gut function.
codebookDescription: log2 (conc.neo+0.000001). Source=calculated.

label: Per protocol stool collection
definition: Whether this was a per protocol stool collection, as defined by the MAL-ED Gut Function Technical Subcommittee. Per protocol first monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age. Per protocol diarrhea stool samples were collected on a day that falls within a diarrheal episode or where the last diarrheal episode ended less than or equal to 7 days ago.
codebookDescription: . .1 =asymptomatic stool age (1-12, 15, 18, 21, 24m); 2=diarrheal 2 (diarrhea_gf=1); NA otherwise . Source=calculated. 1=included; 2=excluded, na = excluded

label: Diarrhea severity score
definition: Combination of Vesikari and Clark scales for diarrhea within -/+ 2 days of stool collection. Values can range from 1 (least severe) to 14 (most severe). Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age.
codebookDescription: severity score for diarrhea days within +/2 days of stool collection. Source=illnessfull.

label: Recollection requested
definition: Reason recollection of the stool sample was requested. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age.
codebookDescription: Was recollection requested?. Source=SRF. yes, monthly specimen <4g = 01, yes, diarrheal specimen <2g = 02, no =00

label: Mucus in stool
definition: Whether the stool sample had mucus. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age.
codebookDescription: Did stool specimen have mucus?. Source=SRF. yes =01; no =00

label: Stool type, gut function
definition: Stool type definition from the MAL-ED Gut Function Technical Subcommittee. 'Other stools' were samples where diarrhea was reported within the preceding 7 days and/or the lactulose:mannitol test was performed on the day of or day before stool collection. 'Asymptomatic stools' were stool samples that did not meet this definition of 'Other stools.' Only 'Asymptomatic stools' were included in the gut function analysis set used in PMID: 28396264. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age were included in analyses of gut function.
codebookDescription: gut function committee stool type definition 0 = asymptomatic; 1 if diarrhea within the preceding 7 days and/or LM test on the day of or day before stool collection. Source=calculated.

label: Target month for stool collection
definition: First monthly asymptomatic stool samples were collected every month from 0-24 months of age, with a possible extension to 36 months of age. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Diarrheal stool samples underwent microbiological testing and gut function testing. First monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age underwent microbiological testing and gut function testing. First monthly asymptomatic samples collected at 13-14, 16-17, 19-20, 22-23 and 25-36 months of age were archived.
codebookDescription: Target/scheduled month. Source=FRQ/FSQ/BRF/UCF/SRF/FSE/MOA. ..

label: Day in diarrheal episode
definition: Whether this day of observation falls within a diarrheal episode. Diarrhea episodes were separated by two diarrhea-free days. Days when data were missing were classified as diarrhea-free (if there were two missing days before a day with diarrhea, the episode started on day with diarrhea). Days with Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M)-induced diarrhea were classified as diarrhea-free. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Was study-defined diarrhea reported on this day?. 1 for all days in episode (all days with ''diarrhea''). From illness dataset. Source=illnessfull.csv. 1=yes;0=no | 1 for all days in episode (all days with "diarrhea"), calculated. General diarrhea data (removes LM induced diarrhea).

label: 1st sample ID if recollection
definition: Sample ID of the initial stool sample, if recollection of the stool sample was requested.
codebookDescription: SampleID of Initial sample. Source=SRF.

label: Days since last diarrheal episode
definition: Days since the last diarrheal episode ended (missing indicates time from birth until first episode). Diarrhea episodes were separated by two diarrhea-free days. Days when data are missing were classified as diarrhea-free (if there were two missing days before a day with diarrhea, the episode started on day with diarrhea). Days with Lactulose:Mannitol (L:M)-induced diarrhea were classified as diarrhea-free. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit.
codebookDescription: Days since last diarrhea episode ended (missing indicates time from birth until first episode). From illness dataset. Source=illnessfull.csv. ### | Days since last diarrhea episode ended (missing indicates time from birth until first episode), calculated. General diarrhea data (removes LM induced diarrhea).

label: Rotavirus (post-vax corrected) Ct value, by TAC result
definition: Cycle time for this stool sample to become positive for Rotavirus by TaqMan Array Card (TAC). If children were within 28 days of receiving a dose of Rotavirus vaccine, any positive 'Rotavirus Ct value, by TAC result' (Ct < 35) was changed to 35 (negative). Quantitative PCR for detection of enteric pathogens via TAC was performed on all available diarrheal and monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected from 0-24 months and at 60 months of age.

label: Stool type
definition: Type of stool type collected, using information from surveillance. 'Diarrhea stools' were samples where diarrhea was reported within +/- 2 days of stool collection. 'Monthly stools' were collected more than 2 days away from an episode of study-defined diarrhea. Surveillance was conducted twice weekly for up to 3 years of age to assess illness on all days since the last surveillance visit. Whenever a participant produced at least 3 loose stools in a single day, diarrheal stool samples were collected before the end of the episode. Work up for detection of enteric pathogens was performed on diarrheal stool samples collected until 24 months of age (with a possible extension to 36 months of age) and on first monthly asymptomatic stool samples collected at 1-12, 15, 18, 21, and 24 months of age (with the option to test additional monthly stool samples to 36 months of age).
codebookDescription: Type of specimen collected. M1=monthly, MR=monthly recollection, D1=diarrheal, DR=diarrheal recollection.Type of stool sample collected. Using information from surveillance. Diarrhea stool = diarrhea reported within +/- 2 days from stool collection. Monthly stool is stool collected more than 2 days away from study defined diarrhea. Source=Calculated. m1 =monthly; d1=diarrhea | Type of specimen collected. M1=monthly, MR=monthly recollection, D1=diarrheal, DR=diarrheal recollection.Type of stool sample collected. Using information from surveillance. Diarrhea stool = diarrhea reported within +/- 2 days from stool collection. Monthly stool is stool collected more than 2 days away from study defined diarrhea. Source=Calculated.

label: Age at household data collection (days)
codebookDescription: Age in days at assessment date. Source=FRQ/FSQ/BRF/UCF/SRF/FSE/MOA. ..

label: Household wealth score
definition: Sum of 8 variables: (i) 'Bank account,' (ii) 'Bed,' (iii) 'Chair,' (iv) 'Table,' (v) 'Television,' (vi) 'Refrigerator,' (vii) 'Separate kitchen,' (vii) 'Fewer than 2 people per room.' Positive responses for each of these variables got a score of 1 while negative responses got a score of 0. Used as a component in calculating the WAMI index and ranged from 0 to 8. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: sum of 8 assets scores. Has?: mattress,chair,table,tv,refrigertaor,bank account,kitchen, < 2 people per room. Positive reponses for each of these get a score of 1 while negative responses get 0. . Source=FSE(derived). range 0-8

label: Currency exchange rate to USD
definition: Currency exchange rate to buy US Dollars. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: Currrency exchange rate to buy US Dollars. Source=Compiled from http://www.oanda.com/currency/historical-rates/. #.###

definition: Whether the dwelling has a separate room which was used as a kitchen, in order to provide additional information on the hygiene status of the household. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: Do you have a separate room which is used as a kitchen?. Source=FSE. yes = 01; no = 00

label: Floor material
definition: Observed main material of the floor. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: Main material of the floor (observation). Source=FSE. earth/sand/clay/mud/dung = 01; wood  = 02;  ceramic tiles or vinyl= 03;cement/concrete = 04; other = 05

label: Family income (local currency)
definition: Average monthly income for the entire household, reported in the local currency. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: NA

label: Maternal education
definition: Whether the participant's mother had ever attended school. This variable refers to formal school only, and includes any formal schooling beginning with kindergarten. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: Have you ever attended school? . Source=FSE. yes = 01; no = 00

label: Maternal education (years)
definition: Years of schooling that the participant's mother had completed, beginning with kindergarten and through any university or post-university education. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.

label: Roof material
definition: Observed main material of the roof. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: Main material of the roofs (observation). Source=FSE. no roof = 01; thatch = 02; metal = 03; wood = 04; brick = 05;tiles = 06;slate = 07;other = 08

label: Room count
definition: The total number of rooms in the house including the veranda, the living and sleeping rooms, as well as attached kitchens used only by this household. It excludes storerooms and separate kitchens that are shared with other families/households. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: How many rooms are there in your house?. Source=FSE. 01-15 (rooms)

label: Persons sleeping in dwelling
definition: Number of people who usually sleep in this household on an average night. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: How many people usually sleep in this household?. Source=FSE. 01-30 (people)

label: Facility type
definition: Type of toilet or latrine facility usually used by members of the household. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: What kind of toilet facility do members of your household usually use? Equal to FSE toilet except when new data provided by TZH, SAV, and PEL conflict. It is preferable to use this variable than the raw variable as correct accounting for type of latrine has been made. . Source=Derived. no facility/bush/field or bucket toilet/pit latrine without slab = 01(unimproved);pit latrine without flush/with slab(improved) = 02;flush to piped sewer system = 03 flush to septic tank = 04 ;flush to pit latrine = 05 ;flush to somewhere else = 06;other = 07

label: Wall material
definition: Observed main material of the walls. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: Main material of the walls (observation). Source=FSE. no walls = 01;mud = 02;wood = 03;cement/concrete = 04;stone = 05;metal = 06;other = 07

label: Drinking water source
definition: The main source of drinking water for members of the household. If the source varies by season, the main source used at the time of interview. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: What is the main source of drinking water for members of your household?. Source=FSE. piped into dwelling = 01; piped to yard/plot = 02 ; public tap/stand pipe= 03 ; tube well or borehole = 04; protected well = 05; unprotected well = 06 ; surface water (river/ dam/ lake/pond/ stream/canal/irrigation canal) = 07 ; other = 08

label: Latrine type, previous
definition: Type of pit latrine previously used, if the style of pit latrine used by members of the household at the time of survey was different than the type used when the participant was 0-2 years of age. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: If NO; type when pit latrine 0-2yrs. Source=TZH latrine. with slab = 1;with no slab = 2;others = 3

label: Income score
definition: Average monthly income for the entire household, converted to US Dollars, categorized into all-site noniles. Used as a component in calculating the WAMI index. Values ranged from 0 to 8. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: Reported income in US Dollars, catgeorized in all-site noniles. Source=FSE(derived). income category cutoffs, noniles of ''newincome'' (created using income data up to 36 months):0: <=36.6; 1: >=36.62 & <=65.7; 2: >=65.8 & <=90.9; 3: >=90.972 & <=111.84; 4: >=111.93 & <=140.72; 5: >=140.76 & <=180.65; 6: >=180.8 & <=250; 7: >=250.05 & <=353.2; 8: >=353.338

label: Drinking water categorization
definition: Whether the household drinking water source was categorized as improved or unimproved, based on WHO definitions. Drinking water sources categorized as 'Improved' include water that is 'Piped into dwelling' or 'Piped into yard or plot,' or from a 'Public tap or stand pipe;' a 'Tube well or borehole;' or a 'Protected well.' Drinking water sources categorized as 'Unimproved' include water that is from an 'Unprotected well' or 'Surface water.' Other sources of drinking water were considered 'Improved,' except for Peru where it was considered 'Unimproved' due to site-specific circumstances. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: Score of drinking water source; 0  for unimproved categories, 4 for improved categories. Source=FSE(derived). if fsewdrink = ''01'',''02'',''03'',''04'',''05'',''08'' then newdrink=4, ''improved'' except for pel where fsewdrink=''08'' is also considered unimproved due to site-specific circumstances; if fsewdrink = ''06'',''07'' then newdrink=0 ''unimproved'', except for pel where values of ''08'' for fsewdrink are considered unimproved

label: Mean people per room
definition: Mean number of people sleeping in each room in the dwelling. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: Mean number of people per room in the household (fsesleep/fseroom1). Source=FSE(derived). #

label: Maternal education score
definition: Years of schooling that the participant's mother had completed, divided by 2. Used as a component in calculating the WAMI index. Values ranged from 0 to 8. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: How many years of schooling have you completed?. Source=FSE. 00-20

label: Family income (USD)
definition: Average monthly income for the entire household, converted to US Dollars. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: Reported income mulitplied by exchange rate. Source=FSE(derived). #

label: Sanitation categorization
definition: Whether the household sanitation facilities were classified as improved or unimproved, based on WHO definitions. Sanitation facilities categorized as 'Improved' include those classified as 'Other,' 'Pit latrine without flush/with slab,''Flush to piped sewer system,' 'Flush to septic tank,' 'Flush to pit latrine,' or 'Flush to somewhere else.' 'No facility/bush/field or bucket toilet/pit latrine without slab' was considered 'Unimproved.' Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: Score of sanitation; 0 for unimproved categories, 4 for improved categories. Source=FSE(derived). if fsetoiletmod = ''01'' then newsanitation=0, unimproved;if fsetoiletmod = ''02'',''03'',''04'',''05'',''06'',''07'' then newsanitation=4, improved

label: Overall socioeconomic score
definition: Sum of all 4 components used to calculate the WAMI index: (i) 'Sanitation and drinking water score,' (ii) 'Assets score,' (iii) 'Income score,' and (iv) 'Maternal education score.' Values ranged from 0 to 32. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: sum of all WAMI component scores. Source=FSE(derived). 0-32

label: Fewer than 2 people per room
definition: Whether fewer than 2 people, on average, sleep in each room in the dwelling. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: Score of 1 if less than 2 people (mean) per room. Source=FSE(derived). #

label: Toilet
definition: Whether the household had a flush toilet or pit latrine. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: Do you have a toilet in your household ?. Source=SAV Latrine. yes = 01; no = 00

label: Toilet or latrine has concrete floor
definition: Whether the household toilet or latrine had a concrete floor. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: Does your household toilet/latrine have a concrete floor?. Source=SAV Latrine. yes = 01; no = 00

label: Toilet or latrine concrete floor before 11/2009
definition: For households with toilets or latrines that had a concrete floor, whether this concrete floor was available before November 2009. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: Was the concrete floor available before November 2009?. Source=SAV Latrine. yes = 01; no = 00

label: Toilet or latrine concrete floor date
definition: Installation date for the household toilet or latrine's concrete floor, if after November 2009. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: When after November 2009 did your toilet/latrine; have a concrete floor. Source=SAV Latrine. date

label: Toilet or latrine concrete floor between 11/2009-02/2014
definition: For households with toilets or latrines that did NOT have a concrete floor, whether the household toilet or latrine had a concrete floor at any time between November 2009 and February 2014. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: If your answer to Question 04 is No, did your toilet/latrine have a concrete floor any time between November 2009 and February 2014? . Source=SAV Latrine. yes = 01; no = 00

label: Sanitation and drinking water score
definition: Sum of sanitation and drinking water scores. Used as a component in calculating the WAMI index. Households with 'Drinking water categorization' and 'Sanitation categorization' variables classified as 'improved' got a score of 4 for each; 'unimproved' responses got a score of 0 for each. Values ranged from 0 to 8. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: Sum of saniation and drinking scores. . Source=FSE(derived). range 0-8

label: Target month for socioeconomic status survey
definition: Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: Target/scheduled month. Source=FRQ/FSQ/BRF/UCF/SRF/FSE/MOA.

label: Latrine type, current
definition: Type of pit latrine used by members of the household at the time of survey. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: Type of pit latrine. Source=TZH latrine. 1=with slab, 2=no slab, 3=no facility, na=no facility

label: WAMI index
definition: An index of socio-economic status that includes access to improved water and sanitation, eight selected assets, maternal education, and household income. The WAMI index was calculated by dividing the 'Overall socioeconomic score' by 32. Socioeconomic status was assessed every 6 months from 6-24 months and again at 60 months of age, with optional assessments from 30-60 months.
codebookDescription: The wami is calculated by summing values of the following variables: sanitation, asset, incat, newfseschool and dividing the total by 32. Source=FSE(derived). range 0-1

label: Animal proteins (meat, eggs, fish)
definition: Whether the participant consumed any animal proteins (including meat, egg, and fish) yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; Consumption of animal proteins (includes meat, egg, and fish). Source=calculated.

label: Diet diversity score for children 0 to 5 months
definition: Diet diversity score for children 0-5 months of age. Values ranged from 0-4. 4 was the highest diversity score a child could receive if he/she consumed breast milk and did not consume tea, milk, juices, formula, or solids in the previous day. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0-4; 4 is the highest diversity score a child could receive if he/she consumes breastmilk and does not consume tea, milk, juices, formula or solids  in the previous day (for children 0-5 months). Source=calculated.

label: Diet diversity score for children 6 to 8 months
definition: Diet diversity score for children 6-8 months of age. Values ranged from 0-6. 6 was the highest diversity score a child could receive if he/she consumed breast milk and 4 or more food groups, fed at least 5 times, and did not consume formula in the previous day. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0-6; 6 is the highest diversity score a child could receive if he/she consumes breastmilk, 4 or more food groups, feeds at least 5 times and does not consume formula in the previous day (for children 6-8 months). Source=calculated.

label: Animal proteins (meat, organ meat, fish)
definition: Whether the participant consumed any animal proteins (including meat, organ meat, and fish) yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; Consumption of animal proteins (includes meat, organ meat, and fish). Source=calculated.

label: Animal proteins (including grains and roots)
definition: Whether the participant consumed any animal proteins (including grains and roots) yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; Consumption of animal proteins (includes grains and roots). Source=calculated.

label: Complementary food introduction
definition: Whether participants 6-8 months of age had been introduced to complimentary foods (any solid, semi-solid,or soft foods) as of yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: o/1; Introducion of complementary foods** Infants 68 months of age who received solid, semi-solid or soft foods during the previous day / Infants 68 months of age. Source=calculated.

label: Dark green leafy vegetables, organ meat, any meat
definition: Whether the participant consumed any iron-rich or iron-fortified foods (including dark green leafy vegetables, organ meat and any meat) yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; 1 if consumption of iron-rich or iron-fortified foods, Version 1 with dark green leafy vegetables, organ meat and any meat. . Source=calculated.

label: Organ meat, any meat
definition: Whether the participant consumed any iron-rich or iron-fortified foods (including organ meat and any meat) yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; 1 if consumption of iron-rich or iron-fortified foods, Version 1a with organ meat and any meat. . Source=calculated.

label: Dark green leafy vegetables, organ meat, any meat, eggs
definition: Whether the participant consumed any iron-rich or iron-fortified foods (including dark green leafy vegetables, organ meat, any meat, and eggs yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; 1 if consumption  of iron-rich or iron-fortified foods, Version 2 with dark green leafy vegetables, organ meat, any meat, and eggs. . Source=calculated.

label: Organ meat, any meat, eggs
definition: Whether the participant consumed any iron-rich or iron-fortified foods (including organ meat, any meat, and eggs) yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; 1 if consumption  of iron-rich or iron-fortified foods, Version 2a with organ meat, any meat, and eggs. . Source=calculated.

label: Dark green leafy vegetables, organ meat, any meat, fish
definition: Whether the participant consumed any iron-rich or iron-fortified foods (including dark green leafy vegetables, organ meat, any meat, and fish) yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; 1 if consumption  of iron-rich or iron-fortified foods, Version 3 with dark green leafy vegetables, organ meat, any meat, and fish. . Source=calculated.

label: Organ meat, any meat, fish
definition: Whether the participant consumed any iron-rich or iron-fortified foods (including organ meat, any meat, and fish) yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; 1 if consumption  of iron-rich or iron-fortified foods, Version 3a with  organ meat, any meat, and fish. . Source=calculated.

label: Dark green leafy vegetables, organ meat, any meat, eggs, fish
definition: Whether the participant consumed any iron-rich or iron-fortified foods (including dark green leafy vegetables, organ meat, any meat, eggs and fish) yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; 1 if consumption of iron-rich or iron-fortified foods, Version 4  with dark green leafy vegetables, organ meat, any meat, eggs and fish.. Source=calculated.

label: Organ meat, any meat, eggs, fish
definition: Whether the participant consumed any iron-rich or iron-fortified foods (including organ meat, any meat, eggs and fish) yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; 1 if consumption of iron-rich or iron-fortified foods, Version 4a  organ meat, any meat, eggs and fish.. Source=calculated.

label: Min acceptable diet for breastfed children
definition: Whether the minimum acceptable diet was met yesterday among breastfed children. Minimum acceptable diet for breastfed children was defined as breastfed children 6-23 months of age who had at least the minimum dietary diversity and the minimum meal frequency during the previous day. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; 1 if minimum acceptable diet is met among breastfed kids. Minimum acceptable diet for breastfed children is defined as breastfed children 623 months of age who had at least the minimum dietary diversity and the minimum meal frequency during the previous day. Source=calculated.

label: Min acceptable diet for non-breastfed children
definition: Whether the minimum acceptable diet was met yesterday among non-breastfed children. Minimum acceptable diet for non-breastfed children was defined as non-breastfed children 6-23 months of age who received at least 2 milk feedings and had at least the minimum dietary diversity not including milk feeds and the minimum meal frequency during the previous day. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; 1 if minimum acceptable diet is met among non-breastfed kids. Minimum acceptable diet for non breastfed children is defined as non-breastfed children 623 months of age who received at least 2 milk feedings and had at least the minimum dietary diversity not including milk feeds and the minimum meal frequency during the previous day. Source=calculated.

label: Min diet diversity of at least 4 food groups yesterday
definition: Minimum dietary diversity (consumption of 4 or more food groups) met during the previous day. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; Consumption of minimum dietary diversity, which is defined as child consuming 4 or more food groups in the previous day. . Source=calculated.

label: Animal milk or formula feedings yesterday
definition: Sum of animal milk and formula feeds yesterday, during night and day. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: Sum of of animal milk feeds during night and day and formula feeds during night and day.. Source=calculated.

label: More than 1 animal milk or formula feeds for non-breastfed kids
definition: Whether the sum of animal milk and formula feeds yesterday was greater than 1 for non breastfed kids. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; 1 if the sum of animal milk and formula feeds is greater than 1 for non breastfed kids. Source=calculated.

label: WHO min meal frequency met
definition: Whether the minimum meal frequency, based on the WHO core indicator definition (2 meals for breastfed children, 4 meals for non-breastfed children), was met yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; Consumption of minimum meal frequency based on WHO core indicator definition. ''1'' if  breastfed child recieved  2 meals and non-breastfed child recieves 4 meals. Source=calculated.

label: Legumes
definition: Whether the participant consumed any foods made with beans, lentils, peas, corn, ground nuts yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; Consumption of foods made with beans, lentils, peas, corn, ground nuts?. Source=MOA.

label: Active breastfeeding
definition: Whether the participant actively breastfed yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; Are you breastfeeding <Child>? . Source=MOA.

label: Breastfeedings yesterday, daytime
definition: Number of times the participant was breastfed yesterday, from sunrise to sunset. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: Yesterday, during the day, how many times did you breastfeed (child)?. Source=MOA.

label: Breastfeedings yesterday, nighttime
definition: Number of times the participant was breastfed last night, from sunset to sunrise. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: Last night, how many times did you breastfeed (Child) from sunset to sunrise?. Source=MOA.

label: Commercially available foods
definition: Consumption of commercially available foods yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; Consumption of any commercially available foods for infants or young children?. Source=MOA.

label: Dairy
definition: Whether the participant consumed any cheese, yogurt or other dairy products yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; Consumption of cheese, yogurt or other dairy products?. Source=MOA.

label: Eggs
definition: Whether the participant consumed any eggs yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; Consumption of eggs. Source=MOA.

label: Feedings yesterday
definition: Number of times the participant was fed yesterday, including meals and snacks. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: Yesterday, counting meals and snacks, how many times did you feed (child)?. Source=MOA.

label: Fish or shellfish
definition: Whether the participant consumed any fresh or dried fish or shellfish yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; Consumption of fresh or dried fish or shellfish?. Source=MOA.

label: Semi solid, mashed, or solid foods
definition: Whether the participant consumed any semi-solid, mashed or solid foods yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; Is (child) eating any semi-solid, mashed or solid foods? . Source=MOA.

label: Infant formula
definition: Whether the participant was given any infant formula yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; Do you give (Child) infant formula?. Source=MOA.

label: Formula feedings yesterday
definition: Number of times the participant was fed yesterday, from sunrise to sunset. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: Yesterday, during the day, how many times did you feed (child) formula?. Source=MOA.

label: Formula feedings last night
definition: Number of times the participant was fed last night, from sunset to sunrise. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.

codebookDescription: 0/1; Consumption of any other fruits or vegetables such as banana, apple, oranges, tomatoes, avocado?. Source=MOA.

definition: Whether the participant consumed any rice, porridge, bread, noodles or other foods made from grains yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; Consumption of rice, porridge, bread, noodles or other foods made from grains?. Source=MOA.

definition: Whether the participant consumed any fruit or vegetable juices yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; Consumption of fruit or vegetable juices?. Source=MOA.

definition: Whether the participant consumed any meat (chicken, beef, lamb, goat, duck, or others) yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; Consumption of any meat, such as chicken, beef, lamb, goat, duck (others)?. Source=MOA.

label: Animal milk
definition: Whether the participant was given other milks (such as tinned, powdered or fresh animal milk) yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1;Do you give (Child) other milks, such as tinned, powdered or fresh animal milk?. Source=MOA.

codebookDescription: 0/1; Consumption of any sugary foods such as pastries, cakes or biscuits?. Source=MOA.

definition: Whether the participant consumed any tea, coffee, or local equivalents yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1;Consumption of  tea, coffee (Local examples)?. Source=MOA.

definition: Whether the participant consumed any plain water yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; Consumption of plain water. Source=MOA.

label: Yellow fruits
definition: Whether the participant consumed any ripe mangoes, papayas, or other sweet yellow/orange or red fruit yesterday. Qualitative dietary diversity was assessed on a monthly basis up to and including 8 months of age.
codebookDescription: 0/1; Consumption of ripe mangoes, papayas, or other sweet yellow/orange or red fruit?. Source=MOA.
